fields.summary: Restrict instance type AWS IAM access policy fails to work on Eucalyptus

comments.body:
This is currently the expected behaviour. In Eucalyptus you must authorize the instance-types (vmtype) the user is allowed to use, which allows the following approach to restricting instance types that pre-dates EC2 support for such restrictions:

https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/admin-guide/access_polextens.html

[~sjones],

Thanks for response.  Any idea when the [new policy model|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/iam-policy-structure.html] will be supported as well?  

FYI, I tried the following policy on AWS and it worked just fine - even though they don't document 'vmtype' anymore in the docs:
{code}
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Action": "ec2:RunInstances",
            "Resource": [
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:986451091583:instance/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.small",
                "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/t1.micro",
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1::image/ami-*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:986451091583:subnet/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:986451091583:network-interface/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:986451091583:volume/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:986451091583:key-pair/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:986451091583:security-group/*"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
{code}
However, I tried the same policy on Eucalyptus 4.2 and it failed.  
{code}
[root@h-08 ~]# euare-grouplistpolicies -g limited-ec2 --region devops-admin@asap-rocky-2015 -v
limitied-instance-type
{
    "Version": "2012-10-17",
    "Statement": [
        {
            "Effect": "Allow",
            "Action": "ec2:RunInstances",
            "Resource": [
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:instance/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.small",
                "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/t1.micro",
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015::image/emi-*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:subnet/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:network-interface/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:volume/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:key-pair/*",
                "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:security-group/*"
            ]
        }
    ]
}

[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t m1.small emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not enough resources: no availability zone is available in which you have permissions to run instances.

[root@h-08 ~]# euca-describe-instance-types --by-zone --show-capacity --region euca-admin@asap-rocky-2015
AVAILABILITYZONE	at-long-last-asap
INSTANCETYPE	Name         CPUs  Memory (MiB)  Disk (GiB)  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE	m1.small        1           256           5     1 /    11      9%
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro        1           256           5     1 /    11      9%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.medium       1           512          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.medium       2           512          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.large        2           512          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.xlarge       2          1024          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.xlarge       2          2048          10     0 /     3      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.xlarge       2          2048          10     0 /     3      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.xlarge       4          2048          15     0 /     3      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.2xlarge      2          4096          30     0 /     1      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.2xlarge      4          4096          30     0 /     1      0%
INSTANCETYPE	cc1.4xlarge     8          3072          60     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	m2.4xlarge      8          4096          60     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	hi1.4xlarge     8          6144         120     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cc2.8xlarge    16          6144         120     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cg1.4xlarge    16         12288         200     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cr1.8xlarge    16         16384         240     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	hs1.8xlarge    48        119808       24000     0 /     0
{code}

I will raise a separate ticket on this issue if you'd like.
You also need to add permission to use an availability zone (which is another Eucalyptus specific IAM extension)

[~sjones],

Yep, actually, I went back to the policy on the link you provided and tried it.  It failed to work.
{code}
[root@h-08 ~]# euare-grouplistpolicies -g limited-ec2 --region devops-admin@asap-rocky-2015 -v
limitied-instance-type
{
  "Version":"2011-04-01",
  "Statement":[{
    "Sid":"2",
    "Effect":"Allow",
    "Action":"ec2:RunInstances",

    "Resource": [
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:vmtype/m1.small",
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:vmtype/t1.micro",
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:image/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:securitygroup/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:keypair/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:availabilityzone/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:asap-rocky-2015:001476132417:instance/*"
]

  }]
}

[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t m1.small emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not authorized to create: cpu by user: arn:aws:euare::001476132417:user/user02
[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t t1.micro emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not authorized to create: cpu by user: arn:aws:euare::001476132417:user/user02
[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t m1.medium emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (UnauthorizedOperation): Not authorized to allocate vm type m1.medium for arn:aws:euare::001476132417:user/user02
[root@h-08 ~]# euca-describe-instance-types --by-zone --show-capacity --region euca-admin@asap-rocky-2015
AVAILABILITYZONE	at-long-last-asap
INSTANCETYPE	Name         CPUs  Memory (MiB)  Disk (GiB)  Used / Total  Used %
INSTANCETYPE	m1.small        1           256           5     1 /    11      9%
INSTANCETYPE	t1.micro        1           256           5     1 /    11      9%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.medium       1           512          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.medium       2           512          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.large        2           512          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m1.xlarge       2          1024          10     0 /     5      0%
INSTANCETYPE	c1.xlarge       2          2048          10     0 /     3      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.xlarge       2          2048          10     0 /     3      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.xlarge       4          2048          15     0 /     3      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m2.2xlarge      2          4096          30     0 /     1      0%
INSTANCETYPE	m3.2xlarge      4          4096          30     0 /     1      0%
INSTANCETYPE	cc1.4xlarge     8          3072          60     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	m2.4xlarge      8          4096          60     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	hi1.4xlarge     8          6144         120     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cc2.8xlarge    16          6144         120     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cg1.4xlarge    16         12288         200     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	cr1.8xlarge    16         16384         240     0 /     0
INSTANCETYPE	hs1.8xlarge    48        119808       24000     0 /     0
{code}
I will raise a ticket regarding this behavior.
[~hspencer], availability zones are not resources within a users account (the ARNs you are using for availability zones and instance types are incorrect)

[~sjones],

I updated the policy following the specification mentioned in the link you provided.  Behavior is the same:
{code}
[root@h-08 ~]# euare-grouplistpolicies -g limited-ec2 --region devops-admin@asap-rocky-2015 -v
limitied-instance-type
{
  "Version":"2011-04-01",
  "Statement":[{
    "Sid":"2",
    "Effect":"Allow",
    "Action":"ec2:RunInstances",

    "Resource": [
    "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/m1.small",
    "arn:aws:ec2:::vmtype/t1.micro",
    "arn:aws:ec2:::image/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:::securitygroup/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:::keypair/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:::availabilityzone/*",
    "arn:aws:ec2:::instance/*"
]

  }]
}

[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t t1.micro emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not authorized to create: cpu by user: arn:aws:euare::001476132417:user/user02
[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t m1.small emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (InsufficientInstanceCapacity): Not authorized to create: cpu by user: arn:aws:euare::001476132417:user/user02
[root@h-08 ~]# euca-run-instances -t m1.medium emi-3992acce --region devops-user02@asap-rocky-2015
euca-run-instances: error (UnauthorizedOperation): Not authorized to allocate vm type m1.medium for arn:aws:euare::001476132417:user/user02
{code}
[~hspencer], in 4.2 we are also checking for instance sub-resources ( EUCA-10587 ) which will break existing policies, so please open a separate issue for that.
Is this the same underlying issue as EUCA-11395?

EUCA-11395 blocks this style of policy, but there is also a difference in behaviour between Eucalyptus and AWS due to Eucalyptus specific functionality allowing restriction of instance types and availability zones via resource ARNs (as per link in previous comment)

[~dmitrii], I think it relates, however I think this issue raises the topic of how similar/different we are compared to AWS with regards to resource ARNs for services.  [~sjones], is there a place we can start documenting this information?  Not sure if we have started something on this or not.
I will find a place to collect differences between AWS and Euca.
[~dcalzago], should this fix version be updated to 4.2.2?
We'll be tracking AWS/Euca differences in the linked DOC ticket. Closing this as the system behaves as designed.
